Let's think step by step.

1. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
2. OFETs (Organic Field-Effect Transistors)

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

2. OFETs

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. μ e - "saturation electron mobility"
2. I on / I off - "current on/off ratio"
3. V th - "threshold voltage"

These are the properties of the OFETs (Organic Field-Effect Transistors) based on the PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to material properties in the given paragraph:

1. μ e - "saturation electron mobility" (a material property that refers to the speed at which electrons can move within a material)
2. V th - "threshold voltage" (a material property that refers to the minimum voltage required to turn on a device)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| μ e | saturation electron mobility |
| V th | threshold voltage |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air.

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. Saturation electron mobility (μe): This is the value of the electron mobility of the OFETs when the current is saturated.
2. Current on/off ratio (Ion/Ioff): This is the ratio of the current flowing through the OFET when it is on to the current flowing when it is off.
3. Threshold voltage (Vth): This is the minimum voltage required to turn on the OFET.

So, the Property Value entities in the paragraph are μe, Ion/Ioff, and Vth.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. Saturation electron mobility (μe): This is the value of the electron mobility of the OFETs when the current is saturated.
2. Threshold voltage (Vth): This is the minimum voltage required to turn on the OFET.

So, the only two entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph are μe and Vth.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Saturation electron mobility (μe) |
| Threshold voltage (Vth) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
